tweet: This past week, I had the privilege of touring the Bug-O-Nay-Ge-Shig School. I look forward to ensuring the federal government fulfills its promise to the Leech Lake Band & provides the educational resources needed to preserve their culture, language, and traditions. pic.twitter.com/FQG93uswMd
My staff and I enjoyed showing students from Ely High School around the U.S. Capitol this afternoon! pic.twitter.com/QE45HrPIEX

ICYMI: The MN PUC’s decision to uphold its approval of the #Line3 replacement project reaffirmed what most of us in northern MN already know: we can safely transport critical natural resources while unleashing the economic engine in our part of the state. https://bit.ly/2WxM0iR

I had the honor of witnessing @POTUS award the late Army Staff Sergeant Travis Atkins with the Medal of Honor. Staff Sergeant Travis Atkins was a hero who went beyond the call of duty and gave his life to save his brothers in arms, earning him our nation’s highest military honor. pic.twitter.com/0jYmzqahYr

Modern air travel is incredibly safe, but in order to keep it that way, we must constantly work to update and improve upon safety protocols. I’m glad that my colleagues on the Committee agree. Learn more about my bill here:  https://bit.ly/2I0iRc5  https://twitter.com/TransportGOP/status/1110909556572463104 …

I spoke in honor of World Down Syndrome Day, which was March 21st. One of the greatest blessings in my life is my 16-year old son Isaac, who has Down Syndrome. I was happy to speak about the value and joy that individuals like Isaac bring to the world: https://bit.ly/2UjM34p

Every student, no matter their circumstance, should be afforded the opportunity to succeed. That’s why I am proud to team up with @RepAngieCraig to ensure the federal government upholds its commitment to students with special needs. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2FwdgY5
Thank you to the Rohlader family from Hermantown for stopping by our D.C. office. I hope you enjoyed your Capitol tour! pic.twitter.com/GJOTeLUSU4

If you’re in the Grand Rapids area, consider stopping by our mobile office hours at the Culvers on Pokegama Ave from 1:30 to 3:30. A member of my staff will be on hand to help you one-on-one w/ any issues you may have w/ a federal agency or department.

On National Medal of Honor Day, we must pause to remember the brave Americans whose service to our nation has been distinguished through extraordinary valor. Today, I'm remembering brave Medal of Honor recipients, like Mike Colalillo & Henry Courtney, who both called #MN08 home.
#ICYMI, see my statement on the findings of the Mueller investigation:  https://bit.ly/2CERalk  pic.twitter.com/4lGDY7yxWY

Today, I visited 4th grade students at Southwest Elementary School. We had a great discussion about the role of the federal government, how a bill becomes law, and what my day-to-day is like. @ISD_318 pic.twitter.com/2KK7FecTIh

Great news! PolyMet now holds all the necessary permits to construct and operate a project that will bring prosperity to our region for decades. I look forward to seeing every community across northeastern MN enjoy the opportunities this mine will create. https://bit.ly/2JzpLYb

On #WorldDownSyndromeDay, Jodi and I celebrate the value and joy that individuals like our son Isaac bring to the world. Isaac’s life is a gift and today, we reaffirm our commitment to empowering individuals who live with disabilities. pic.twitter.com/mRErWPa8Z5
It was a pleasure meeting with you all! https://twitter.com/alzMNND/status/1108514495977140230 …

ICYMI: I recently held a roundtable discussion with farmers from #MN08 to hear their concerns and learn more about the issues impacting the agriculture industry. I am thankful for their feedback. To get a recap of our discussion, click here: https://bit.ly/2OiUOWF

My DC staff had a great visit with students from Eveleth-Gilbert High School this afternoon. These students are in Washington participating in the Close Up program to take an inside look at democracy in action. @CloseUp_DC pic.twitter.com/YcEQ2uI5cP

My office is currently accepting art submissions for the 2019 Congressional Art Competition. This competition is an exciting opportunity for high school students in #MN08 to showcase their artistic talents! Learn more below: https://bit.ly/2T0y0f7

I was honored to be joined by farmers and agriculture experts from across the state for my Agriculture Roundtable. We discussed ways I can advocate for Minnesota’s farmers in Congress and keep our proud #ag tradition thriving. pic.twitter.com/p6oSS3XFAs

This morning, I toured the Enchanted Dairy Farm in Little Falls to see firsthand how a dairy farm operates & discuss dairy policy issues. The dairy industry is an integral component of our economy, so I will do everything I can to promote policies that help dairy farmers succeed. pic.twitter.com/XoZYTW3h8R

March is National Kidney Month, so I was glad to stop by the DaVita Dialysis Center to learn more about the needs of dialysis patients and treatment options for kidney disease. @DaVita pic.twitter.com/9cgQIMWz2L

Met w/ Marc Johnson of the East Central MN Educational Cable Cooperative & received updates on the work being done to improve broadband access across #MN08. This is great news bc communities w/out reliable broadband risk being left behind in our technology-driven economy. pic.twitter.com/QhBRaQAULT

This past weekend, I toured the Heritage Living Center in Hubbard County and learned about the different issues impacting nursing homes. I was glad to have a chance to thank their staff for the incredible work they do to care for Minnesota’s seniors. pic.twitter.com/EbDaB604At

If you made less than $66,000 last year, you qualify for free tax assistance! IRS #FreeTaxPrep services like #FreeFile are helping MN taxpayers save more this tax season. To learn more visit http://irs.gov/freefile

Today, the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service unveiled a proposed rule to remove the gray wolf from the list of endangered and threatened wildlife in the lower 48 states. This proposed rule is long overdue as the gray wolf species has been recovered for years. https://bit.ly/2HlD9wO

Tomorrow, a member of my staff will hold mobile office hours from noon to 1 pm at the Hackensack City Hall. If you need assistance navigating a federal agency, please stop by! Our #1 priority is constituent service so we will regularly hold mobile office hours throughout #MN08!
It was great meeting Jakub! Enjoy the rest of your time in Minnesota. https://twitter.com/CivEdWorkshop/status/1105941174374809600 …

My office is now accepting applications for the 2019 Congressional Art Competition. This competition is open to all high school students in #MN08 and I encourage participation from all interested students. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2T0y0f7

My first bill was signed into law! The North Country Scenic Trail Route Adjustment Act will give recreationists the chance to experience even more of our region’s stunning scenery, all while enhancing tourism and bringing more revenue to our local economy! https://bit.ly/2EVH5Rv

Thanks to the students from @iLeadMN for stopping by my office and discussing what we can do at the federal level to reduce tuition costs for students attending community and technical colleges. pic.twitter.com/Tn4x4SLRNf

I recently toured the CN Ore Dock in Duluth to learn about the transport of iron ore from MN to other parts of the world. I also had the chance to take a look at the SS Arthur M. Anderson, which was the last ship to be in contact w/the SS Edmund Fitzgerald before it sank in 1975. pic.twitter.com/kjWM9g0UWv
Had a great tour of @IPSCRANES earlier today. I was glad to learn more about the important role they play in supporting Minnesota’s railway system. pic.twitter.com/O3xKqLrEQ9

I will always stand up for the freedom to choose our own leaders. What I won’t stand for is Washington D.C. taking over elections. That’s why I could not vote in support of H.R. 1, a bill that would mandate government funding for candidate robocalls and negative ads.

I was glad to meet with members of the Minnesota Police and Peace Officers Association this afternoon and let them know what we are doing at the federal level to support them. I will always have the backs of our brave law enforcement officers! pic.twitter.com/mMtOnJvwdM

I was proud to receive the Congressional Champion of Change Award from @NDSS. This award is special to me bc my 16 yr old son Isaac has Down syndrome. As Isaac’s dad, and now as a member of Congress, I promise to always be a strong advocate for those who live with disabilities. pic.twitter.com/Zy9Aj7zKnv

Today, I introduced a bill to require any barrier along the U.S. – Mexico border be made of steel produced in the United States. This will help northern Minnesota’s mining economy and strengthen national security. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2TjwIAP

Yesterday, I had the chance to spend time w/the good people of Walker, MN.
